name: places/ChIJo5apG-5YwokRt4sXAOMs-Sk
formattedAddress: 101 Worth St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 101 Worth St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: The late night manager would not accept my spot hero reservation. Argued with me for over 20 minutes way past midnight. Condescending and told me I didn’t belong there. Claimed the garage was only for the people living in the building next to it even tho it is open to the public. I wish I got his name but he was the Sunday night overnight guy on 2/11/24. Showed him several times that spot hero says I’m booked here and that I can’t even rebook because it says I’ve already booked this time.

text.text: The late night manager would not accept my spot hero reservation. Argued with me for over 20 minutes way past midnight. Condescending and told me I didn’t belong there. Claimed the garage was only for the people living in the building next to it even tho it is open to the public. I wish I got his name but he was the Sunday night overnight guy on 2/11/24. Showed him several times that spot hero says I’m booked here and that I can’t even rebook because it says I’ve already booked this time.

originalText.text: This was the first time using this garage, when pulling in, the staffer told us to pull up but failed to clarify how far. Then proceeded to yell at us for going too far. They failed to tell us that we would have to pay an ADDITIONAL fee for size of vehicle on top of the outrageous amount we paid to park for less than 5 hours. When we picked up our car, the staffer was incredibly rude and handled our car recklessly when brining it back to us by speeding around the corner so hard that they made our tires screech. Will NEVER be using this place again.

text.text: This was the first time using this garage, when pulling in, the staffer told us to pull up but failed to clarify how far. Then proceeded to yell at us for going too far. originalText.text:
Despite paying the required parking fee, we were unable to access the parking lot and had to wait for over half an hour without being able to park our vehicle. The situation escalated to a point where the traffic was severely congested, prompting the intervention of the NYPD.

Upon the arrival of the NYPD, we were informed by the staff that the parking lot was closed and were advised to find alternative parking. When we returned to seek a refund for the parking fee we had paid, we were met with rude behavior from the staff who denied any responsibility for the inconvenience caused and refused to issue a refund.

This experience was extremely frustrating and has caused us not only financial loss but also wasted our valuable time.

originalText.text:
Only 1 unfriendly and incompetent attendant.
Line of cars trying to get in and a line of people trying to get out.
When he finally brings a car out it's the wrong vehicle and belongs to no one.
It took us 40 minutes to get our car and leave. On a Sunday. Why?

originalText.text: Got in here and it mentioned early bird only checked in 12:50 PM and checked out 1:14 PM for less than half hour they’re charging me $60, completely unacceptable and straight robbery. Now I called the cops and they’re blocking my way out because I refused to pay $60
